documentation.text:
@notice Owners or repos or orgs can create new gov tokens which are used to vote on proposals.
         New tokens are minted and awarded to those who complete bounties for the associated repo or org.

@param _name Name of the new token
 @param _symbol Token Symbol for the new token

@param _to Address of recipient for new tokens
 @param _amount Amount of new tokens to create

@param _from Address from whose tokens will be destroyed
 @param _amount Amount of tokens to destroy

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Transfers are only allowed by the Octobay contract"

arguments.value: Transfers are only allowed by the Octobay contract

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Transfers are only allowed by the Octobay contract"

documentation.text: @notice Explicitly disabling transfers by individual owners

@param _account Address for whose balance we're asking
 @return The balance of the given account as a percentage of total supply (0 - 10000)

@notice Open to all at the moment, but we could limit this to only the governor if needed
 @return The ID of the snapshot, used later to look up balances and totalSupply at a certain block

attributes.text:
@notice Owners or repos or orgs can create new gov tokens which are used to vote on proposals.
         New tokens are minted and awarded to those who complete bounties for the associated repo or org.

@param _name Name of the new token
 @param _symbol Token Symbol for the new token

@param _to Address of recipient for new tokens
 @param _amount Amount of new tokens to create

@param _from Address from whose tokens will be destroyed
 @param _amount Amount of tokens to destroy
@notice Explicitly disabling transfers by individual owners

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Transfers are only allowed by the Octobay contract"

attributes.type: literal_string "Transfers are only allowed by the Octobay contract"
attributes.value: Transfers are only allowed by the Octobay contract

attributes.text:
@param _account Address for whose balance we're asking
 @return The balance of the given account as a percentage of total supply (0 - 10000)

@notice Open to all at the moment, but we could limit this to only the governor if needed
 @return The ID of the snapshot, used later to look up balances and totalSupply at a certain block

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._account: Address for whose balance we're asking

returns._0: The balance of the given account as a percentage of total supply (0 - 10000)

params._account: Address for whose balance we're asking
params._snapshotId: Snapshot ID for the block at whose balance we'd like to check

returns._0: The balance of the given account as a percentage of total supply (0 - 10000)

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Retrieves the balance of `account` at the time `snapshotId` was created.

params._from: Address from whose tokens will be destroyed

params._symbol: Token Symbol for the new token

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._amount: Amount of new tokens to create
params._to: Address of recipient for new tokens

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: The ID of the snapshot, used later to look up balances and totalSupply at a certain block

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).details: Retrieves the total supply at the time `snapshotId` was created.

params._recipient: Address of who will receive the tokens
params._sender: Address from whose tokens will be taken

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

snapshot().notice: Open to all at the moment, but we could limit this to only the governor if needed

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Explicitly disabling transfers by individual owners

userdoc.notice: Owners or repos or orgs can create new gov tokens which are used to vote on proposals.         New tokens are minted and awarded to those who complete bounties for the associated repo or org.
